title: Sell Wine
metaDescription: Sell your fine wine collection to Proof Cellars. We buy Bordeaux, Burgundy, Napa cult wines, and more. Direct offers with no fees.
heroSubhead: We buy fine wine directly - from single bottles to full cellars.
introParagraph: Whether you have a few bottles of sought-after Burgundy or a full cellar of Bordeaux, Napa, and other collectible wines, we provide direct offers with no consignment fees. Our straightforward process: submit photos and details, receive an offer, and get paid after we receive and verify your wine.
whatWeBuy: Bordeaux first growths and classified estates
Burgundy grand cru and premier cru
Italian fine wines (Barolo, Brunello, Super Tuscans)
Other fine wines from recognized producers
whatWeDoNotBuy: Wine with visible seepage or heat damage
Bottles with extremely low fill levels
Wines from unknown storage conditions without documentation
Items we cannot legally purchase in your state
photoChecklist: Front label showing producer, vintage, and appellation
Capsule condition (intact, no signs of leakage)
Fill level visible in the bottle neck
Original wood case or packaging if available
Any damage, staining, or condition issues
conditionFactors: Fill level must be appropriate for the wine's age - excessive ullage significantly reduces value
Capsule condition is critical - any signs of seepage or leakage are problematic
Label condition matters - staining and damage reduce value but age-appropriate wear is expected
Storage history is important - documentation of proper cellar conditions adds value
Original wood cases add value for wines sold in cases
Provenance documentation strengthens value for high-end bottles
pricingFactors: Current market demand for the specific wine
Bottle condition, fill level, and label presentation

faqs.question: What wines do you buy?
faqs.answer: We buy fine wines from recognized regions including Bordeaux, Burgundy, Napa Valley, Rhone, Italy, and other collectible wine areas. Contact us with your specific bottles or cellar inventory.

faqs.question: Do you buy full wine cellars?
faqs.answer: Yes. We purchase full cellars and large collections. For cellar buyouts, we can review an inventory list and provide an offer for the complete collection.

faqs.question: How important is storage history?
faqs.answer: Storage history matters significantly for fine wine. Wines stored in temperature-controlled environments retain more value. If you have documentation of storage conditions, include it.

faqs.question: What fill levels are acceptable?
faqs.answer: Acceptable fill levels depend on the wine's age. Recent vintages should have high fills. Older wines may show some natural ullage. Send photos and we will evaluate.

faqs.question: Do original wood cases add value?
faqs.answer: Yes. Original wood cases (OWC) add value, especially for wines originally sold in cases. Include photos of any original packaging.

faqs.question: How do you handle large collections?
faqs.answer: For large collections, send an inventory list with as much detail as possible. We can provide a preliminary offer range and then refine after reviewing photos.

faqs.question: What if I do not know my wine's value?
faqs.answer: Send photos and details through our form or by text. We will research the wines and provide an offer based on current market values.

faqs.question: How quickly can you evaluate my wine?
faqs.answer: Single bottles and small lots typically receive offers within one business day. Larger cellars may take two to three days depending on the number of bottles.
